Can you explain selection bias in Epidemiology using directed acyclic graphs

Certainly!

Selection bias is a type of bias that occurs when the characteristics of the sample in an epidemiological study are not representative of the population as a whole. This can happen when the sample is not randomly selected, which can lead to the inclusion of individuals who are different from the population being studied.
